page.title: 18HOTELS,RESTAURANTS,S.SELSEY
page.content: The{Seal Hotel}was built in 1899.It started as two houses and changed to a hotel in 1970.There are eleven bedrooms and five public rooms.{ { }The{Double Barn}was built in 1905 as a house and became a hotel in 1951.In 1964 it became a Club.There are over 800 members. { }The{Lifeboat Inn}is 140 years old. The name was changed from the Albion fifteen years ago.It has two bars _the Cuddy and the Foredeck.It was built originally as a fishermen's inn, and is opposite the Lifeboat Station. { }The{Selsey Bill}was originally a cottage and has been a public house and restaurant for seven years. The{Thatched House}has been a hotel since 1953.There are seven letting bedrooms and a restaurant,serving Selsey fish dishes as a speciality. {Rushmere}is a small thatched hotel.
